intro: Morelosia reticulata, commonly known as the netted morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is known for its climbing habit, often winding around supports. Its flowers open in the morning and close by midday, giving it its common name. The species is also noted for its intricate leaf venation patterns, which contribute to its ornamental value.
